newsitem.title: USA: Davis boosts Carter-Wallace buy offer - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Davis boosts Carter-Wallace buy offer - WSJ.

text.p: Billionaire investor Marvin Davis has boosted his offer for Carter-Wallace Inc to $928 million or $20 a share, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.
Two weeks ago, the health-care products firm's shareholders rejected the investor's earlier offer of $18 a share.
The newspaper cited a letter that the investor's company Davis Co sent to the firm's chairman on Friday as saying: "(he was) prepared to negotiate an agreement to acquire the company."
Carter-Wallace owns brands like Trojan condoms and Arrid deodorants.
